alert.note: Alert for Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 5:04PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Jefferson and Leon. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Monticello, Lloyd, Baum, St. Marks Headwaters Greenway, Capitola, Lake Miccosukee, Chaires, Chaires Crossroads, Lois, Pisgah Church, Apalachee Regional Park, Nash, Casa Blanco, Ralford Greenway, Montivilla, Drifton, Miccosukee Road Greenway and Tom Brown Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
